Events that occurred on 13 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien is found unfit for duty for six months, but able to do a desk job.
1938 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 34.
1962 - Tim Tolkien is born.
1968 - Riddles in the Dark, the third episode of the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, is aired on BBC Radio.
1968 - Stanley Unwin dies.
2007 - Ring*Con 2007 in Fulda, Germany.
2015 - The Art of The Lord of the Rings is published in the USA.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by VoronwÃ«, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
With Frodo severely wounded, Strider and the four hobbits travel slowly towards Rivendell. They cross the Last Bridge and find the beryl left by Glorfindel.
Gandalf hurries towards Rivendell after the Black Riders attacked him on Weathertop.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
